title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Monday 11 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: birstall house explosion : three people taken to hospital .
fire service confirm blast was gas explosion .
evacuated residents told to go to village hall .
drivers told to avoid side roads .
airport apology over passengers 'left waiting on plane for hours ' .
school closures across the east midlands due to cold weather .
teenage cyclist dies after beeston bus crash .

documents.title: trafficker paid 'slaves ' 35p an hour
text: trafficker paid 'slaves ' 35p an hour

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear throughout the night .
east midlands live will return tomorrow morning .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: weather update : temperatures could fall to -10c
text: the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for ice until 11:00 tomorrow .
ice is expected to form on untreated roads , pavements and cycle paths .
expect a widespread frost tonight under clear skies .
in rural spots , temperatures could fall as low as -10c ( 14f ) .
temperatures in towns and cities are expected to be between -1c ( 30f ) and -5c ( 23f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: birstall explosion : community praised by council
text: a council has praised residents following an explosion at a house in birstall this morning .
residents were evacuated after a number of properties were damaged following the blast .
charnwood borough council says people who have been able to go back to their properties have done so , while others unable to return to their homes have been given accommodation .
the rest centre at # birstall has now closed .
people have gone back into their properties if they have been able to and those who have not , we have worked with them to make sure they have somewhere to go .
that has included temporary accommodation .
we would like to thank the birstall community who have rallied around to help those affected by today 's incident .
we have had many donations of food and drink .
any food and drink not used at the centre has been given to a local cafe who are kindly distributing to those affected .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed after trafficking five people to derby
text: a derby man has been jailed for three years and nine months after admitting trafficking five people to derby to exploit them .
miroslav bily admitted keeping the five at a house in osmaston and in a caravan in chellaston ( below ) and getting them to work for little or no money .
the 51-year-old , of sinfin lane , derby , brought the victims to the uk from the czech republic by ferry .
police say he targeted vulnerable men who thought they would be coming to the uk for a better life .
the men were put to work doing jobs such as painting and decorating , or were employed in a garage or restaurant .
but bily gave them nothing , or next to nothing , in cash .
police detectives calculated that for one decorating job , the men received just 35p an hour .

judge peter cooke said : `` people who are in a foreign country whose language they do not speak find it far from straight forward to complain about how they are being treated or contact the authorities .
`` it 's that very isolation in which parasitic human beings like you feed . ''
author: Matthew Barlow
BBC Radio Derby reporter

documents.title: residents given bottled water after main bursts
text: vulnerable residents in melton are being given bottled water because a burst water main is affecting some properties in the area .
severn trent water said engineers are trying to fix the problem but in the meantime their teams were checking on `` vulnerable customers who may not be able to leave the house to get water '' .
there are 15 vans currently delivering bottled water .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: last day for consultation into boundary changes
text: today is the final day of a public consultation into the potential reshaping of some of nottinghamshire 's parliamentary seats at the next general election .
the proposals by the boundary commission could see the gedling constituency disappear completely .
rushcliffe would be cut in two and the lines of the broxtowe seat would be redrawn to exclude beeston but take in hucknall .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: airport staff apologise to passengers waiting for hours
text: a number of flights were delayed at east midlands airport today because of the cold weather .
there were reports of some jet2 planes being rescheduled and delayed .
passengers had boarded a plane for lanzarote but were left waiting for four hours before it eventually took off at 14:09 .
the airport and jet2 have apologised for any inconvenience caused .
an east midlands airport spokesman said : `` our runway is open and has been operational since 14:36 yesterday .
`` however , as is the case with other airports across the country , there are some delays today due , in part , to the low temperatures which continue to have an impact on operations . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: traffic delays due to burst water main
text: there are traffic delays in nottingham city centre because of a burst water main on london road .
one lane towards towards canal street has been closed since about 10:30 this morning .
engineers from severn trent water are at the scene .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : woman in critical condition
text: a woman remains in a critical condition following a gas explosion at a house in birstall this morning .
one man is still in hospital in a stable condition , while another man that was taken to hospital has now been discharged .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: delays after m1 crash
text: there are delays on the m1 northbound between junction 20 for lutterworth and junction 21 for leicester after a crash .
all lanes have reopened .
vehicles moved to the hardshoulder by @ twitterid # m1 northbound between j20 # lutterworth and j21 # leicester , all lanes now open .
delays back to j20 , please approach with care .
many thanks to @ twitterid for attending .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: paying mothers can 'incentivise breastfeeding '
text: offering shopping vouchers to new mothers can encourage them to breastfeed their babies , a study published in jama pediatrics has found .
about 10,000 new mothers in yorkshire , derbyshire and nottinghamshire were offered up to £ 200 in vouchers as an incentive .
breastfeeding rates increased in these areas , which ty have low uptake .
the vouchers gave mums a `` lift '' and helped them feel part of a network , according to the researchers .
they could be used to buy food , household items , toys , clothes , books , dvds or music in supermarkets and other shops .
author: Kate Silver
BBC News health reporter

documents.title: from the archives : keith chegwin 's leicestershire wedding
text: press association have just re-released this poignant photograph of keith chegwin 's wedding to maggie philbin , following news of his death .
the ceremony took place in the village of little stretton , leicestershire , in september 1982 .
philbin paid tribute to her former husband , saying : `` it is incredibly sad .
keith was a one-off .
full of life , generous and with a focus on things that mattered - his family . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: blyth in photographic journey along a1
text: babs ' cafe in blyth , nottinghamshire , has featured in this photographic journey along britain 's longest numbered road - the a1 .
embarking on a visual road trip , peter dench photographed the characters and locations he encountered as he drove the length of the road including bab 's cafe .
alongside her husband pendleton , she has worked in this roadside cabin for 27 `` long '' years .
just over a mile up the road , visitors to flo 's cafe can read complimentary copies of the truckstop news while a cardboard cut-out of the queen watches over .
peter dench said he wanted to meet the people of the uk and explore the idea of british identity in the age of brexit .
author: BBC News

documents.title: man 'threatened with knives over snowballed car '
text: an investigation is under way to find a group of teenagers who police believe threatened a man with knives after he asked them to stop throwing snowballs .
nottinghamshire police said the attempted assault took place at about 18:25 last night in radford boulevard .
the victim was also spat at after he asked the teeangers to stop throwing snowballs at his car , the force added .
the alleged attackers are believed to be four black males , who are all aged between 15 and 16 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: peaty : my 2017 'better than 2016 '
text: swimmer adam peaty has claimed his efforts in 2017 are `` more pleasing '' than his olympic successes in 2016 .
peaty , a former city of derby swimmer who now trains at loughborough , won two olympic golds in rio in 2016 , adding 50m and 100m breaststroke world titles earlier this year .
he recorded the second quickest time in history , 57.47secs , in winning the 2017 100m world title in july , before clocking two world records in a day en route to adding the 50m breaststroke crown .
`` i 'm more pleased with this year , '' the 22-year-old told press association sport .
`` i think it 's been a much better year .
as a whole it 's been very , very good , very successful . ''
author: Press Association

documents.title: snowy afternoon in bamford
text: there is still plenty of snow at ladybower reservoir near bamford in derbyshire .
this was photographed by officers from derbyshire police this afternoon .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: 'iconic ' two ronnies script set for auction
text: an original handwritten ronnie barker comedy script is set to be sold at auction .
the manuscript , for the two ronnies four candles sketch , is expected to fetch between £ 30-40,000 .
it is has previously been voted one of the nation 's favourite comedy sketches .
jim spencer , a manuscript expert at hansons auctioneers , said : it 's as familiar as del boy falling through the bar , or basil fawlty saying , 'do n't mention the war ' '' .
the script , which previously sold for £ 48,000 in 2007 , will go under the hammer at hansons , in etwall , derbyshire , on 20 december .

the lot also includes a pair of spectacles used in the two ronnies , a letter signed by ronnie barker , an authentication certificate and a colour print of the four candles sketch signed by ronnie barker and ronnie corbett .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: airport apology over passengers 'left waiting on plane for hours '
text: east midlands airport has confirmed the flight to lanzarote , which was due to depart at 09:45 this morning , was expected to leave at 13:50 today .
according to flight radar 24 , the flight departed at 14:09 .
staff at the airport have apologised to passengers for the delays .
the jet2 plane was originally scheduled for 10:20 yesterday .
it was rescheduled for 09:45 today but passengers said they had been waiting for four hours on the plane .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: barnsley 0-3 derby county
text: barnsley 0-3 derby county

documents.title: 'dambusters training area ' covered by snow
text: derwent reservoir looking particularly stunning
a view of the dambusters training area .
1976 actually walked round the village of derwent .
usually submerged .
stunning
just up the road from me .
it 's a beautiful place all year round .
a walk around the dam and a in front in summer is perfect .
i saw 2 lancs fly over last year - brilliant .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: weather warning for ice across east midlands
text: a yellow weather warning for ice is in place from 16:00 gmt this afternoon until 11:00 gmt on tuesday .
these patches of ice and any remaining snow could lead to further travel disruption and tricky driving conditions tonight and tomorrow morning .
the situation is changing all the time , so please do keep an eye on the bbc weather website .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: passengers 'left waiting on plane for four hours '
text: a frustrated passenger on a flight to lanzarote says the plane has been stuck on the runway for four hours .
james whitfield said the jet2 plane was meant to take-off yesterday at 10:20 but it was delayed , which meant they were put up in a hotel overnight .
he said the flight was rescheduled for 09:45 this morning but passengers have been sitting in the plane for four hours .

mr whitfield , who has tweeted us from the plane , said : `` no sign of any movement , still not de-iced the plane and likelihood is there will be no food available until we land four hours from take off . ''
a spokesperson for east midlands airport said they were `` looking into this '' .
we have contacted the airport for a full statement .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: derby election fraud trial : mr fernandez took proof of material
text: christopher fernandez has told the court he did take petitions about the closure of the moorways swimming pool with him as he collected election nomination signatures .
but he said they were proof of previous campaigning material .
he said the nomination form was on top of his clipboard , and the petition underneath .
he said : `` i never went out with the deliberate intention to deceive people . ''
mr fernandez told derby crown court how he went about collecting nomination signatures for tusc candidates .
`` the first thing i did was ask if they were on the electoral register .
`` i was aware of the rules ( on door-to-door canvassing ) .
i had to make sure that they were understanding what i was saying . ''
christopher fernandez , 59 , from chaddesden has denied 14 counts related to the nomination of candidates for the city 's local elections .
the trial continues .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: derby election fraud trial : signatory felt 'misled '
text: the trial of a derby political activist accused of fraudulently collecting signatures to get his party 's candidates on the 2016 ballot papers has heard more evidence that the signatories did n't know what they were being asked to do .
christopher fernandez , 59 , from chaddesden has denied 14 counts related to the nomination of candidates for the city 's local elections .
in a police interview , mr fernandez said : `` it was my first time as an election agent and i wanted to do a good job .
`` for ( those signatories ) to say they 've never heard of tusc is quite incredible . ''
he told police one of the signatories had delivered leaflets for tusc ( trade unionist and socialist coalition ) .
this morning , derby crown court heard the evidence of john hudson , who has died since giving his account to police .
mr hudson said he thought mr fernandez was an independent candidate .
he said he did not know the form belonged to another candidate , or that they were from the tusc .
he said he felt misled .
the case for the defence is due to begin shortly .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: dawson willcock : funeral to be held on friday
text: the funeral of a two-year-old boy who died from a rare form of liver cancer will be held on friday .
dawson willcock from sutton-in-ashfield was diagnosed earlier this year and when chemotherapy did n't work his parents wendy and david fundraised for treatment in america .
the dollar for dawson campaign raised £ 380,000 but they were told his cancer was `` too aggressive '' for treatment and dawson passed away last month .
wendy said : `` he laughed in the face of cancer , he constantly was laughing , he never cried in pain or sorrow , he never felt sorry for himself .
`` he would make us laugh every single day , even in his final days . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: four-vehicle crash in buxton
text: it may be best to avoid the square in buxton this afternoon .
derbyshire fire and rescue service is currently dealing with a four-vehicle crash .
1133 crews from # buxton blue & # buxton rds are at the square , buxton dealing with an rtc involving 4 vehicles , no persons trapped .
crews are making scene safe .
please be careful around this area as the road and pathways are particularly icy
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : emas praises emergency workers
text: east midlands ambulance service has praised the emergency services for their `` teamwork '' in dealing with the house explosion in allington drive this morning .
awesome @ twitterid teamwork today with colleagues from @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid providing critical care to patients # teamwork # jesip @ twitterid

documents.title: fundraising effort under way for explosion victims
text: a fundraising page has been set up to help those affected by this morning 's gas explosion at a property in birstall .
dozens of people have already made donations totalling more than £ 700 .
one of the people who donated , kelly yeomans , wrote on the page : `` feeling so helpless when only just down the road !
`` sending love and prayers to all that need help . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: some properties without water in melton
text: there are reports of some properties without water in melton this morning .
engineers are working to fix the problem .
thank you to everyone for your patience in melton this morning if you 're without water , we 're working hard to get everything back to normal as quickly as possible .
please see here for more info :
any further news ?
we 're a livestock farm with over 1000 thirsty animals .
hello , we 're not sure yet how long it 's going to take to get everyone back on supply but it 's our absolute priority to get the water back on and everything back to normal as quickly as possible .
updates can be found here :
how do we get water delivered ?
seems we 've been forgotten ?
we have two young children and a livestock farm and no water .
hello - we have only delivered water to our vulnerable customers on our priority list .
we are looking into possible bottle drops at the moment .
holly
how long before its fixed no water bottled or otherwise here !
more information please on your link as it does n't seem as positive as it was last night .
i 'm so sorry for the inconvenience of the burst pipe , most people should start to see their supply return shortly .
there should now just be two areas without water to whom we are delivering bottled water to .
please see : brierley
hi can you confirm how the bottle drop is being managed as bottles seem to have been dropped off randomly at some houses and not others with no obvious link to 'vulnerable ' households ?
good evening helen , our customers registered on our vulnerable list would always bee seen to first , this is for those who are dependant on water for various medical reasons .
we are now delivering to all those affected in the area also .
@ twitterid hoping for an update soon , been without water since mid morning in and have a 3 week old baby who needs water for her bottles
hi claire - i 'm really sorry to hear this .
you can find our latest update here :
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: supermarket robbed at knifepoint
text: officers are trying to trace a man who robbed a supermarket at knifepoint in kirby-in-ashfield .
nottinghamshire police said the man entered the co-op on chapel street at about 21:00 on saturday where he stole some cash .
police said the offender was black , had his face covered and was wearing a dark coloured coat .
he ran towards victoria road .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : three people taken to hospital
text: two people have been airlifted to hospital following this morning 's house explosion in allington drive .
another person will be taken to the leicester royal infirmary by ambulance .

tim hargraves , from east midlands ambulance service , said : our hazardous area response team , a paramedic in an ambulance car , three ambulance crews , two air ambulances and the east midlands emergency care scheme have been dispatched to the scene and are working hard to provide emergency medical and trauma care and treatment . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : temporary accommodation to be provided
text: council staff and volunteers will be providing emergency temporary accommodation to residents affected by the explosion in allington drive in birstall .

a charnwood borough council spokesman said : we were called to support the emergency services following reports of a loud bang and a house being damaged in allington drive , birstall , earlier this morning .

we have sent a senior officer to the scene , an officer from our building control team and volunteers to help provide temporary emergency accommodation at birstall parish council offices in birstall .
an officer is also visiting the scene in case people affected by the incident need short-term temporary accommodation in the coming days . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : everyone accounted for
text: everyone has now been accounted for following a gas explosion in birstall this morning , leicestershire fire and rescue service has said .
the fire service added three people are being treated for their injuries .
both warwickshire & northamptonshire air ambulance and derbyshire , leicestershire & rutland air ambulance were also in attendance .
a spokeswoman confirmed they treated two patients but said they could not give further information `` due to patient confidentiality '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: lane blocked after water pipe bursts in nottingham
text: one lane is currently blocked on london road in nottingham due to this burst water pipe .
author: Maryam Qaiser

text: this is the scene in allington drive after the gas explosion this morning .

documents.title: birstall explosion : residents told to go to village hall
text: residents who 've been affected by the gas explosion in allington drive have been told by police to go to the village hall on birstall road .
update | 0945 | everyone who has been evacuated in relation to this incident is asked to go to the village hall on birstall road .

documents.title: fire crews confirm blast was gas explosion
text: leicestershire fire and rescue service has confirmed the explosion at the house in birstall was a gas explosion .
but the service added there are no reports of a fire and there is no smell of gas at this time .
the main property has collapsed and neighbouring properties partially collapsed .
six other properties have also been partially affected .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : council officers at the scene
text: council officers from charnwood borough council are at the scene of the house explosion in allington drive this morning .
we 're aware of the incident in # birstall and supporting the emergency services .
we will be ensuring residents ' welfare is looked after and have officers on the scene , including from our building control team .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: breakingbirstall explosion : one person unaccounted for and three injured
text: one person is unaccounted for after the explosion in birstall , according to leicestershire fire and rescue service .
three people have been reported injured - one has been taken to hospital and two were treated at the scene .
the explosion happened in allington drive at about 07:30 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: birstall explosion : 'nature of injuries not yet known '

documents.title: breakingtwo people injured in house explosion
text: two people have been injured in an explosion at a house in birstall this morning .
leicestershire police said they were called to allington drive at 07:30 .
emergency services are at the scene and allington drive will remain closed for several hours .

text: there are reports of an explosion at a house in birstall in leicester this morning .

our first thoughts are with all those involved .

the girl was taken to the queen 's medical centre in nottingham but died yesterday afternoon .

documents.title: good morning join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning .

we 're starting off the live page nice and early today to keep you across the latest travel news and any disruption because of the cold weather in derbyshire , nottinghamshire , leicestershire and rutland .
you can get in touch via facebook or tweet us .
